I purchased two of these as the reviews are very good and I have difficulty finding shirts in tall sizes.  I bought the XL Tall size shirts.  The first thing I do before trying on a shirt or purchasing them in a store is measure-I carry a tape measure when shopping.  I need a shirt with a length from the bottom of the collar (hem) to the center of the tail to be at least 35 inches...most "true" tall size shirts are 35-1/2 to 36 which is typically 3" longer than the standard sizes.  These measure 33-1/2".  I'm 6'-5" with extra long torso and when I tried the shirt on and raised my arms, it popped out from the tuck on both sides.  I don't know what the length of their standard size measures but if they are shorter than the tall sizes they may be too short for taller men who can usually wear standard size.  It seems that a lot of shirt makers are following this trend in the last couple of years but my height has not followed the same trend!  Further, the overall weight of the shirts is very light...probably OK as a dressier casual shirt but not for actual dress situations.  I cannot recommend these for business attire."

I loved this shirt when I picked it out online as a Christmas gift for my husband, then I had second thoughts once it arrived. The fabric was a good weight, but was thinner than I had envisioned. Also, the colors were a bit more vivid than I thought they would be. Nevertheless, I went ahead and gave the shirt to him, and it was a big hit! He loved the weight and the colors, the price was decent, and the fit was perfect. No complaints!
